userInterface
Class WaiterUI

java.lang.Object
  userInterface.WaiterUI

public class WaiterUI
extends java.lang.Object

The WaiterUI class displays the window for a waiter. The waiter sees a map of tables in the restaurant like the host or busboy. The waiter also has an additional section of their window to display the bill for a specific table that they are in charge of when they touch that table. There is also a drop down menu to select order items, a text box for a comment for that specific order, and add and remove order buttons. This allows a waiter to add and remove specific orders from the bill for any one of their tables. There is also a button to set the table status to dirty after the diners have left, and a logout button.

Author:
Kalev Roomann-Kurrik

Constructor Detail

WaiterUI

public WaiterUI()
This is the constructor for the WaiterUI class and is called whenever a new waiter window is needed. It generates the window, displays the map of tables, and sets up the bill display, drop down menu, text box, and all of the required buttons for the window.

Method Detail

getMenu

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getMenu()
This method is called from the constructor and gets a list of names for all of the food items on the menu. This is used to let the waiter select orders to add to the bill for a table from a drop down menu which shows all of these names.

Returns:
Returns the ArrayList of Strings representing the food names.

getBill

public void getBill(Table aTable)
This method is called whenever a waiter touches a table that is assigned to them. It calls a method in the Waiter Account class which then gets the bill object from a specific table which is part of the map for the restaurant. Once the bill has been retrieved the data from the bill (list of orders with comments and price, and total price for the bill) is displayed in a window inside the main waiter window.

Parameters:
aTable - The table that the bill belongs to.

addDish

public void addDish(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String comment,
                    Bill theBill)
This method is called whenever a waiter touches the add dish button on their window. After having selected a specific dish name from the drop down menu, and possibly having added comments in the textbox for this dish, touching the add dish button will get all of the required dish information, as well as the bill that the dish is going on, and then calls a method in the Waiter Account class which then takes care of adding the order to the bill for that table.

Parameters:
name - The dish's name.
comment - Any special comments for this order.
theBill - The bill that this order is being added to.

removeDish

public void removeDish(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String comment,
                       Bill theBill)
This method is called whenever a waiter touches the remove dish button on their window. If the waiter selected a specific order off of the bill display then touching this button will remove the order from the list of orders for that bill. This method calls a method in the Waiter Account class which then takes care of actually removing the order from the bill. The name and comment strings are passed to find the specific order on the bill.

Parameters:
name - The dish's name.
comment - Any special comments that the order had to help identify the correct order.
theBill - The bill that this order is being removed from.

setTableDirty

public int setTableDirty(Table aTable)
This method is called whenever a waiter touches the dirty table button on their window. This method calls a method in the Waiter Account class which then takes care of setting the specific table's status to dirty, and setting the number of diners for that table equal to zero. This then gets updated in the map of tables for the restaurant, so that the busboy and host can see the change as well.

Parameters:
aTable - The table that just became dirty.
Returns:
Returns a 1 if the table was set dirty, and a -1 otherwise.

logout

public void logout()
This method is called whenever a waiter clicks on the logout button. It will close the WaiterUI window, and bring back the login window.
